nodes.text: IoT based home appliances can be managed remotely and make human life easier through sensor connectivity and Internet-enabled control
This paper is a literature review of IoT for home automation synthesizing prior designs, technologies, protocols, benefits and challenges
IoT represents an environment where appliances are connected to sensors and the Internet to enable remote control and automated operation
IoT-based home automation provides multiple user benefits including monitoring, efficiency, cost and quality-of-life improvements
Better monitoring of devices is enabled by device-to-device transmission reducing need for direct user intervention
IoT systems increase efficiency and save user time by automating repetitive tasks and enabling remote operation
IoT enables optimum energy and resource use, leading to cost savings when devices are observed and managed
Integration of AI with IoT applications can improve comfort, convenience and overall quality of life
Preset automated programs can create smart environments by regulating windows, shades, temperature and monitoring pollution
IoT devices support health monitoring applications for hospitals and to assist elderly or disabled persons by tracking physiological patterns
Major IoT communication technologies and protocols relevant to home automation include Bluetooth/BLE, ZigBee, Z-Wave, WiFi, Cellular, NFC and LoRaWAN
A WiFi-based home automation prototype using WiFi infrastructure demonstrated basic appliance control and remote monitoring (Ahmed ElShafee 2012)
A low-cost, expandable IoT home automation system was experimentally shown to control simple appliances remotely (Vinay Sagar 2015)
Security, privacy and user expertise limitations are recurring challenges that constrain IoT adoption and reliability
IoT applications extend beyond homes to smart cities, industrial automation, healthcare and environmental monitoring
Conclusion: IoT has broad scope and growing adoption across sectors; combining AI and IoT is proposed to further enhance comfort and convenience
